column1: Avoid surprising bears. Make noise while hiking to alert them of your presence.
Never feed bears. Human food is unhealthy for them and can lead to dangerous behavior.
Keep a safe distance from bears. Do not approach or attempt to get close for photos.
Store food and trash securely to avoid attracting bears to campsites.
If you encounter a bear, remain calm and slowly back away. Do not run.
Carry bear spray and know how to use it in case of a bear encounter.
Stay alert in bear country. Be aware of signs of bear activity such as tracks or scat.
Travel in groups when hiking in bear country. Bears are less likely to approach large groups.
Respect bear habitat and avoid disturbing or damaging it.
Follow local regulations and guidelines for bear safety when visiting bear country.
